ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
0 = neither; 1 = right; 2 = left; 3 = bilateral; blank = Missing Form/Incomplete Workbook
NA= QCd unacceptable, no better available; N= QCd and found to be unacceptable; NR= QCd unacceptable, chosen for release; Y=QCd and found to be acceptable; YD= Not QCd and accepted by default
X= does not meet QC standard; Blank = Not QC'd or meets QC standard
X= does not meet QC standard; Blank = Not QC'd or meets QC standard
X= does not meet QC standard; Blank = Not QC'd or meets QC standard

Possible values: AP Pelvis; Bilateral PA Fixed Flexion Knee; Full Limb; Lateral Left Knee; Lateral Right Knee; PA Bilateral Hand; PA Fixed Flexion Left Knee; PA Fixed Flexion Right Knee; PA Hand; PA Left Hand; PA Right Hand
O=Over-exposed; U=Under-exposed; Blank = Not QC'd or meets QC standard
X= does not meet QC standard; Blank = Not QC'd or meets QC standard

1 = Participant not eligible; 2 = Prosthetic; 3 = Equipment failure; 4 = Other; 5 = Only one knee repeated; 6 = Refused; 7 = Participant did not show for appointment; 9 = Not available; 12 = Missed visit; blank = Missing form/incomplete workbook/Not expected
X= does not meet QC standard; Blank = Not QC''d or meets QC standard
